item.description:
Wells National Estuarine Research Reserve at Laudholm Farm contains seven miles of hiking and cross-country skiing trails providing access to woodlands, fields, wetlands, beach, and dunes. Spectacular views and diverse habitats make the Reserve an especially popular destination for nature photographers and birdwatchers. We'll hike the trails and the beach and then stop in the visitor's center, located in the main farmhouse, which contains interpretive exhibits and a gift shop. Figure on 3+ hours of easy hiking, including rests.

The Wells Reserve is a 2,250-acre research, education, and recreation facility, a public-private partnership within the National Estuarine Research Reserve System. Wells Reserve facilities are located at historic Laudholm Farm in Wells, Maine.

Dogs are not allowed on the Reserve.

Directions: Northbound from I-95, take exit 19 (Wells) and follow signs to U.S. Route 1 in Wells. Follow Route 1 north 1.5 miles to Laudholm Farm Road (just north of the Lighthouse Depot and south of the Maine Diner, at the second flashing traffic signal). Turn right and follow signs to the Reserve.

We'll stop for food afterward, of course...

Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.

Liability Release
AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.  Fee is for meetup site expenses and planning.
item.name: Wells Reserve Walk/Hike
